lexUnit.name: wave.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move (one's hand or arm, or something held in one's hand) to and fro.

sentence.text: Someone in the column seemed to recognise me ; he was shouting and waving his arms .
It made Bella shriek and wave her arms about and it set Joe drumming his fingers on the table with that quiet disapproval that was worse than anything Bella could do .
The priest waved his arms up and down and exhorted us ` Be the angels of your homes " .
Pedrosa waves his arms about in the air furiously when asked if Mota could ever set a world record .
Pardy just stood there , looking pleased with himself -- he waved his arms in a kind of salute .
` He ran towards the herd yelling , shooting and waving his arms .
Ask him particularly whether you have any irritating mannerisms : scratching yourself , adjusting your tie , pulling your clothes , waving your arms unduly , or swaying hypnotically .
He waved his arms and finally the noise of conversation died .
Interpretive dancers rushed about the chamber , waving their arms and trying to keep the fruit piled on their headdresses from coming loose .
Hawkins waved a dismissive hand at his lime juice .
She waved a hand towards the pile of debris on the cart .
She waved a hand towards another detached house at the bottom of the garden .
I nodded weakly , wished I had n't , waved a hand more weakly .
She waved an airy hand and stifled a yawn .
He waved his hand airily .
She waved her hand outwards and upwards .
She waved her hand in the direction of the open door where beyond a wilderness of pretty villas , stacked white-washed town houses and holiday apartments filled the landscape .
He waved a hand towards the forest before hunkering down by the fire .
That sounds almost a lifetime to me at the moment ! " she wailed , waving her hands distractedly in the air .
Paul waves his hands , meaning everything .
It was the wet nose of one of Raimundo 's shaggy lurchers , who was frantically waving her long crooked tail .
He shrugged and waved his hands aimlessly , as if ten dozen contrary reasons presented themselves .
` Fish is such wonderful stuff , so perishable and so delicate , " enthuses Mr Black , waving at the glorious display of shellfish all around us .
They smiled and waved at her , and she hurried back to the desk blushing .
She let the clutch in and drove towards the road ; she waved at him out of the window .
He leaned out of the window and waved at passers-by .
I watched him walk towards Daffodil , who was waving to him vigorously , and take the place saved by her handbag .
Owen was about to move away when one of his men appeared above the parapet and waved to him urgently .
She waved towards the baskets at her feet .
Peter waved towards the cupboard .
A tentacle waved towards her .
She held her glass aloft in her left hand , waved hugely with her right .
No deaths or injuries , but a few hands waving feebly from under the pile of bodies indicated that rescue was required .
She was heading for the supermercado when a flaxen-haired man with a teak-dark tan waved vigorously from beyond a group of onlookers on the opposite side of the square .
There they were , lined up on the steps , waving excitedly .
` When they shout abuse at me , I wave graciously and say ` Thank you for your support " .
Again his hand waved languidly .
With his right arm he swam , and with his left he waved wildly , shouting as loudly as he could .
